definition: to describe sth as/an analogy/a simile/a metaphor/an allegory

sentences.english: So what are we to do with this allusion?
sentences.chinese: 我們怎樣來看這個暗喻呢？

sentences.english: You will find you can use similes and metaphors to create powerful images.
sentences.chinese: 你將會發現運用明喻和暗喻能創造出強有力的圖像。

sentences.english: I don't understand what your metaphors are all about.
sentences.chinese: 我不明白你暗喻的是什麼。

sentences.english: These images of contradiction are understood by the artist as a metaphor for modern times.
sentences.chinese: 這些矛盾的意向可以被藝術家作爲現代的暗喻來理解。

sentences.english: The camel sign fragrant cigarette case bottom color is faint yellow , metaphor broad desert.
sentences.chinese: 駱駝牌香菸盒的底色是淡黃色，暗喻廣闊的沙漠。

sentences.english: Metaphors and mnemonic devices can increase retention by as much as 40%.
sentences.chinese: 暗喻和記憶法可以把記憶力提高多達40%。

sentences.english: Mapping content and properties came easily, but what about the browsing metaphor?
sentences.chinese: 內容和屬性的映射非常容易，但是瀏覽暗喻會怎樣呢？

sentences.english: It was a good metaphor for the confusion of the time.
sentences.chinese: 這對當時混亂的局勢是一個很好的暗喻。

sentences.english: You don't know what a metaphor is.

definition: to use sth as a metaphor
pun/play on words/a phrase with a double meaning
moral (of a story)/lesson to be learned/implication/message/import/metaphorical meaning
to make a pun/to have a double meaning/double entendre
